title: Hypotheses
text: If the friend says his mean golf score is 63, that means the null hypothesis is: $$µ=63$$. Since you want to test whether his true score is higher, the alternative hypothesis is: $$H_a$$: $$\mu>63$$.

title: Alternative Hypothesis
text: The alternative hypothesis, $$H_a$$, tells you if the test is left, right, or two-tailed. It is the key to conducting the appropriate test.

title: Less Than, Greater Than, Not Equals
text: If the alternative hypothesis uses the \"less than\" sign, then you are dealing with a left-tailed test. If the alternative hypothesis uses the \"greater than\" sign, then you are dealing with a right-tailed test. If the alternative hypothesis uses a \"not equal\" to sign, then you are dealing with a two-tailed test.
